findings.title: Dangerous strict equalities
findings.description: Tautology or contradiction, potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Tautology or contradiction
findings.description: The code contains a tautology or contradiction which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Missing Zero Address Validation
findings.description: The contract does not validate if an address is zero before performing operations.

findings.title: Using block.timestamp
findings.description: The usage of block.timestamp can be vulnerable to manipulation by miners and can cause unintended behavior.

findings.title: Using SHA3
findings.description: Using SHA3 instead of keccak256 can lead to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Using suicide
findings.description: The 'suicide' function is used which can lead to unintended contract behavior.

findings.title: Using throw
findings.description: The 'throw' keyword is used which can cause unintended behavior and make the contract vulnerable to reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Inefficient use of balanceOf function that leads to high gas usage
findings.description: Calling balanceOf function which internally reads stream struct again while the parent function already reading stream struct before calling the balanceOf function that leads to multiple sloads which is unnecessary.
